question:
World Health Organization (WHO) has declared India free from which of the following diseases?
  1. Trachoma
  2. Avian Influenza (H5N8 and H5N1)
  3. Yaws
Select the correct option from codes given below:
explanation: Recently, India declared itself free from Trachoma, a chronic infective disease of the eye. As per the National Trachoma Survey Report (2014-17), the current overall prevalence found in the country is only 0.7%. However, this is still much below the elimination criteria of infective trachoma as defined by the WHO. Similarly, in June 2017, India declared itself free from highly pathogenic Avian Influenza- H5N1 and H5N8. Yaws is a kind of chronic bacterial infection which mostly affects skin, bones and joints. In 2016, WHO and UNICEF declared India free of Yaws.
